description: Creates an IdMappingWorkflow object which stores the configuration of the data processing job to be run. Each IdMappingWorkflow must have a unique workflow name. To modify an existing workflow, use the UpdateIdMappingWorkflow API.

parameters.name: workflowName
parameters.description: The name of the workflow. There can't be multiple IdMappingWorkflows with the same name.

parameters.name: inputSourceConfig
parameters.description: A list of InputSource objects, which have the fields InputSourceARN and SchemaName. (dict) --- An object containing InputSourceARN, SchemaName, and Type. An Glue table Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or a matching workflow ARN for the input source table. schemaName (string) --- The name of the schema to be retrieved. type (string) --- The type of ID namespace. There are two types: SOURCE and TARGET. The SOURCE contains configurations for sourceId data that will be processed in an ID mapping workflow. The TARGET contains a configuration of targetId which all sourceIds will resolve to.

nested_params.name: inputSourceARN
nested_params.description: An Glue table Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or a matching workflow ARN for the input source table.

nested_params.name: schemaName
nested_params.description: The name of the schema to be retrieved.

nested_params.name: type
nested_params.description: The type of ID namespace. There are two types: SOURCE and TARGET. The SOURCE contains configurations for sourceId data that will be processed in an ID mapping workflow. The TARGET contains a configuration of targetId which all sourceIds will resolve to.

parameters.name: outputSourceConfig
parameters.description: A list of IdMappingWorkflowOutputSource objects, each of which contains fields OutputS3Path and Output. (dict) --- The output source for the ID mapping workflow. The S3 path to which Entity Resolution will write the output table. KMSArn (string) --- Customer KMS ARN for encryption at rest. If not provided, system will use an Entity Resolution managed KMS key.

nested_params.name: outputS3Path
nested_params.description: The S3 path to which Entity Resolution will write the output table.

nested_params.name: KMSArn
nested_params.description: Customer KMS ARN for encryption at rest. If not provided, system will use an Entity Resolution managed KMS key.

parameters.name: idMappingTechniques
parameters.description: An object which defines the ID mapping technique and any additional configurations. The type of ID mapping. ruleBasedProperties (dict) --- An object which defines any additional configurations required by rule-based matching. rules (list) --- The rules that can be used for ID mapping. (dict) --- An object containing RuleName, and MatchingKeys. A name for the matching rule. A list of MatchingKeys. The MatchingKeys must have been defined in the SchemaMapping. Two records are considered to match according to this rule if all of the MatchingKeys match. (string) --- The set of rules you can use in an ID mapping workflow. The limitations specified for the source or target to define the match rules must be compatible. The comparison type. You can either choose ONE_TO_ONE or MANY_TO_MANY as the attributeMatchingModel. If you choose MANY_TO_MANY, the system can match attributes across the sub-types of an attribute type. For example, if the value of the Email field of Profile A matches the value of the BusinessEmail field of Profile B, the two profiles are matched on the Email attribute type. If you choose ONE_TO_ONE, the system can only match attributes if the sub-types are an exact match. For example, for the Email attribute type, the system will only consider it a match if the value of the Email field of Profile A matches the value of the Email field of Profile B. The type of matching record that is allowed to be used in an ID mapping workflow. If the value is set to ONE_SOURCE_TO_ONE_TARGET, only one record in the source can be matched to the same record in the target. If the value is set to MANY_SOURCE_TO_ONE_TARGET, multiple records in the source can be matched to one record in the target. providerProperties (dict) --- An object which defines any additional configurations required by the provider service. The ARN of the provider service. providerConfiguration (document) --- The required configuration fields to use with the provider service. intermediateSourceConfiguration (dict) --- The Amazon S3 location that temporarily stores your data while it processes. Your information won't be saved permanently. The Amazon S3 location (bucket and prefix). For example: s3://provider_bucket/DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET.

nested_params.name: ruleBasedProperties
nested_params.description: An object which defines any additional configurations required by rule-based matching.

nested_params.name: rules
nested_params.description: The rules that can be used for ID mapping.

nested_params.name: ruleName
nested_params.description: A name for the matching rule.

nested_params.name: matchingKeys
nested_params.description: A list of MatchingKeys. The MatchingKeys must have been defined in the SchemaMapping. Two records are considered to match according to this rule if all of the MatchingKeys match.

nested_params.name: ruleDefinitionType
nested_params.description: The set of rules you can use in an ID mapping workflow. The limitations specified for the source or target to define the match rules must be compatible.

nested_params.name: attributeMatchingModel
nested_params.description: The comparison type. You can either choose ONE_TO_ONE or MANY_TO_MANY as the attributeMatchingModel. If you choose MANY_TO_MANY, the system can match attributes across the sub-types of an attribute type. For example, if the value of the Email field of Profile A matches the value of the BusinessEmail field of Profile B, the two profiles are matched on the Email attribute type. If you choose ONE_TO_ONE, the system can only match attributes if the sub-types are an exact match. For example, for the Email attribute type, the system will only consider it a match if the value of the Email field of Profile A matches the value of the Email field of Profile B.

nested_params.name: recordMatchingModel
nested_params.description: The type of matching record that is allowed to be used in an ID mapping workflow. If the value is set to ONE_SOURCE_TO_ONE_TARGET, only one record in the source can be matched to the same record in the target. If the value is set to MANY_SOURCE_TO_ONE_TARGET, multiple records in the source can be matched to one record in the target.

nested_params.name: providerProperties
nested_params.description: An object which defines any additional configurations required by the provider service.

nested_params.name: providerServiceArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the provider service.

nested_params.name: providerConfiguration
nested_params.description: The required configuration fields to use with the provider service.

nested_params.name: intermediateSourceConfiguration
nested_params.description: The Amazon S3 location that temporarily stores your data while it processes. Your information won't be saved permanently.

nested_params.name: intermediateS3Path
nested_params.description: The Amazon S3 location (bucket and prefix). For example: s3://provider_bucket/DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET.

parameters.description: The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource. (string) --- (string) ---

nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role. Entity Resolution assumes this role to create resources on your behalf as part of workflow execution.
